channel.title: Disable gpg-agent passphrase caching by default (already done in Whonix 13)
channel.description:
When encrypting a file, for example, symmetric:
>gpg -c filename
and then decrypting
>gpg filename.gpg
The file gets decrypted without gpg asking for a passphrase.
As explained in:
https://security.stackexchange.com/questions/103034/gnupg-decryption-not-asking-for-passphrase
The passphrase gets cached by gpg-agent for some time.
For better security, this caching should be disabled or set to the minimum possible.
Solution from the above link:
>For newer versions (v2.1+), disable password caching for the agent by creating `~/.gnupg/gpg-agent.conf` and adding the following lines: >``` >default-cache-ttl 1 >max-cache-ttl 1 >```
**There was no such caching (issue already solved) in Whonix 13**

item.description:
When encrypting a file, for example, symmetric:

gpg -c filename

and then decrypting

gpg filename.gpg

The file gets decrypted without gpg asking for a passphrase.

As explained in:

security.stackexchange.com

GnuPG decryption not asking for passphrase

encryption, pgp, gnupg
asked by EsseTi on 10:58AM - 18 Oct 15 UTC

The passphrase gets cached by gpg-agent for some time.

For better security, this caching should be disabled or set to the minimum possible.

Solution from the above link:

For newer versions (v2.1+), disable password caching for the agent by creating ~/.gnupg/gpg-agent.conf and adding the following lines:

default-cache-ttl 1
max-cache-ttl 1

There was no such caching (issue already solved) in Whonix 13
